      • setAnimationSequence

        public void setAnimationSequence(SkeletalAnimationSequence sequence)
        Sets a new SkeletalAnimationSequence. It will use this one immediately no blending will be done.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The new SkeletalAnimationSequence to use.

      • transitionToAnimationSequence

        public void transitionToAnimationSequence(SkeletalAnimationSequence sequence,
                                 int duration)
        Transition to a new SkeletalAnimationSequence with the specified duration in milliseconds. This method will use a LinearInterpolator for interpolation. To use a different type of interpolator use the method that takes three arguments.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The new SkeletalAnimationSequence to transition to.
        duration - The transition duration in milliseconds.

      • transitionToAnimationSequence

        public void transitionToAnimationSequence(SkeletalAnimationSequence sequence,
                                 int duration,
                                 Interpolator interpolator)
        Transition to a new SkeletalAnimationSequence with the specified duration in milliseconds. The Interpolator is an Android SDK Interpolator and can be one of AccelerateDecelerateInterpolator, AccelerateInterpolator, AnticipateInterpolator, AnticipateOvershootInterpolator, BounceInterpolator, CycleInterpolator, DecelerateInterpolator, LinearInterpolator, OvershootInterpolator.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The new SkeletalAnimationSequence to transition to.
        duration - The transition duration in milliseconds.
        interpolator - The Interpolator

        Description copied from class: Object3D

        Overrides:
        render in class Object3D
        Parameters:
        camera - The camera
        projMatrix - Matrix4 The view-projection matrix
        vMatrix - Matrix4 The projection matrix
        parentMatrix - Matrix4 The view matrix
        pickerInfo - The current color picker info. This is only used when an object is touched.

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Description copied from class: Object3D
        The reload method is called whenever the OpenGL context needs to be re-created. When the OpenGL context was lost, the vertex, uv coord, index etc data needs to be re-uploaded.
        Overrides:
        reload in class AAnimationObject3D
